alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:07AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Henderson, southwestern Rock Island, Mercer, southwestern Henry, northeastern Des Moines, southern Louisa, southwestern Scott and southeastern Muscatine Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 207 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Andalusia to near Grandview. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Rock Island, Muscatine, Aledo, Wapello, Milan, Burgess, Blue Grass, Buffalo, Andalusia, Fruitland, Viola, Millersburg, Matherville, New Boston, Alpha, Sherrard, Keithsburg, Grandview and Reynolds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 24 and 31. Interstate 280 between mile markers 6 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
